page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Two of the most obvious aspects of farming in Hullavington are the herds of cows that walk through The Street twice a day.They come from Gardener's and Lawn Farms & are owned by Mr Greenman and Mr Hawker.Mr Greenman has 100 cows including young cattle.He does not milk his cows anymore.Mr Hawker has 450 cows altogether and milks his cows twice a day at 4.15am and again at 3.00pm.Mr Greenman has 5 different breeds of cows. These are Simmental,Fresians,Herefords,Limousins and Charollais.Mr Hawker only has Dutch Fresians.Mr Hawker's cows give 3000 litres of milk per day, which is 6.666 litres each.Mr Hawker has cows for beef,dairy replacement & milking.One of the photographs shows the cows walking through Hullavington.
